subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXNPWLOX
WWUS76 KLOX 290315
NPWLOX

URGENT - WEATHER MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
815 PM PDT SAT APR 28 2007

..AREAS OF DENSE FOG ALONG THE SOUTHWESTERN CALIFORNIA COAST
OVERNIGHT...

AREAS OF DENSE FOG WILL AFFECT COASTAL AREAS OVERNIGHT.
VISIBILITIES AT MANY LOCATIONS WILL BE REDUCED TO ONE QUARTER MILE
OR LESS. HOWEVER...IMPROVED VISIBILITIES ARE EXPECTED BY LATE
TONIGHT FOR THE COAST OF SOUTHERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTY...AND
VENTURA AND LOS ANGELES COUNTIES. THE COAST OF SAN LUIS OBISPO AND
NORTHERN SANTA BARBARA COUNTIES SHOULD HAVE AREAS OF DENSE FOG
INTO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING...BEFORE VISIBILITIES IMPROVE AROUND MID
MORNING.

CAZ041-291000-
/O.NEW.KLOX.FG.Y.0009.070429T0315Z-070429T1000Z/
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
815 PM PDT SAT APR 28 2007

..DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SUNDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS ISSUED A
DENSE FOG ADVISORY...WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PDT SUNDAY.

AREAS OF DENSE FOG WITH VISIBILITIES OF ONE QUARTER MILE OR LESS
WILL AFFECT LOCATIONS MAINLY ALONG THE IMMEDIATE COAST
OVERNIGHT...INCLUDING THE REGION IN AND AROUND MALIBU.
BY LATE TONIGHT VISIBILITIES SHOULD IMPROVE TO ONE HALF MILE OR
MORE.

A DENSE FOG ADVISORY MEANS VISIBILITY WILL FREQUENTLY BE REDUCED TO
ONE QUARTER MILE OR LESS. IF DRIVING...SLOW DOWN...USE YOUR
HEADLIGHTS...AND LEAVE PLENTY OF DISTANCE AHEAD OF YOU. FOG CAN ALSO
MAKE ROAD SURFACES SLICK SO AVOID USING EXCESSIVE SPEED.

$$

CAZ040-291000-
/O.NEW.KLOX.FG.Y.0009.070429T0315Z-070429T1000Z/

815 PM PDT SAT APR 28 2007

CAZ034-035-291000-
/O.NEW.KLOX.FG.Y.0009.070429T0315Z-070429T1600Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
815 PM PDT SAT APR 28 2007

..DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT SUNDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS ISSUED A
DENSE FOG ADVISORY...WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT SUNDAY.

AREAS OF DENSE FOG WILL AFFECT LOCATIONS MAINLY ALONG THE
IMMEDIATE COAST THIS EVENING THEN SPREAD INLAND SOME OVERNIGHT. THE
DENSE FOG SHOULD PERSIST INTO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING. VISIBILITIES
OF ONE QUARTER MILE OR LESS CAN BE EXPECTED. BY MID MORNING SUNDAY
VISIBILITIES SHOULD IMPROVE TO ONE HALF MILE OR MORE.

A DENSE FOG ADVISORY MEANS VISIBILITY WILL FREQUENTLY BE REDUCED TO
ONE QUARTER MILE OR LESS. IF DRIVING...SLOW DOWN...USE YOUR
HEADLIGHTS...AND LEAVE PLENTY OF DISTANCE AHEAD OF YOU. FOG CAN ALSO
MAKE ROAD SURFACES SLICK SO AVOID USING EXCESSIVE SPEED.

$$

SIRARD
